tags.html: dns/zone
{module:dns/change}

code: var Change = require('./change.js');

tags.html: {module:dns/record}

code: var Record = require('./record.js');

tags.html: {module:common/streamrouter}

code: var streamRouter = require('../common/stream-router.js');

tags.html: {module:common/util}

code: var util = require('../common/util.js');

tags.html: module:dns/zone

var gcloud = require('gcloud');

var dns = gcloud.dns({
keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json',
projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123'
});

var zone = dns.zone('zone-id');

description.full:
A Zone object is used to interact with your project's managed zone. It will
help you add or delete records, delete your zone, and many other convenience
methods.
description.summary:
A Zone object is used to interact with your project's managed zone. It will
help you add or delete records, delete your zone, and many other convenience
methods.

tags.string:
{module:dns/record|module:dns/record[]} record - The record objects to
    add.
tags.name: record

description.full:
Add records to this zone. This is a convenience wrapper around
{module:dns/zone#createChange}.
description.summary:
Add records to this zone. This is a convenience wrapper around
{module:dns/zone#createChange}.

tags.string: {error} If an id is not provided.

tags.html: {module:dns/change}
var change = zone.change('change-id');

description.full: Create a reference to an existing change object in this zone.
description.summary: Create a reference to an existing change object in this zone.

tags.string:
{module:dns/record|module:dns/record[]} options.add - Record objects
    to add to this zone.
tags.name: options.add
tags.description: • Record objects to add to this zone.

tags.string:
{module:dns/record|module:dns/record[]} options.delete - Record
    objects to delete from this zone. Be aware that the resource records here
    must match exactly to be deleted.
tags.name: options.delete
tags.description:
• Record objects to delete from this zone. Be aware that the resource records here
    must match exactly to be deleted.

tags.html:
var oldARecord = zone.record('a', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: '1.2.3.4',
ttl: 86400
});

var newARecord = zone.record('a', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: '5.6.7.8',
ttl: 86400
});

zone.createChange({
add: newARecord,
delete: oldARecord
}, function(err, change, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// The change was created successfully.
}
});

description.full: Create a change of resource record sets for the zone.
description.summary: Create a change of resource record sets for the zone.

tags.string: {boolean} options.force - Empty the zone before deleting.
tags.name: options.force

tags.html:
zone.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// The zone is now deleted.
}
});

//-
// Use force to first empty the zone before deleting it.
//-
zone.delete({
force: true
}, function(err, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// The zone is now deleted.
}
});

description.full:
Delete the zone.

Only empty zones can be deleted. Set options.force to true to call
{module:dns/zone#empty} before deleting the zone. Two API calls will then be
made (one to empty, another to delete), which means this is not an
atomic request.
description.body:
Only empty zones can be deleted. Set options.force to true to call
{module:dns/zone#empty} before deleting the zone. Two API calls will then be
made (one to empty, another to delete), which means this is not an
atomic request.

tags.string:
{module:dns/record|module:dns/record[]|string} record - If given a
    string, it is interpreted as a record type. All records that match that
    type will be retrieved and then deleted. You can also provide a
    {module:dns/record} object or array of objects.
tags.name: record
tags.description:
• If given a string, it is interpreted as a record type. All records that match that
    type will be retrieved and then deleted. You can also provide a
    {module:dns/record} object or array of objects.

tags.html:
var oldARecord = zone.record('a', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: '1.2.3.4',
ttl: 86400
});

var callback = function(err, change, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// Delete change modification was created.
}
};

zone.deleteRecords(oldARecord, callback);

//-
// Delete multiple records at once.
//-
var oldNs1Record = zone.record('ns', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: 'ns-cloud1.googledomains.com.',
ttl: 86400
});

var oldNs2Record = zone.record('ns', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: 'ns-cloud2.googledomains.com.',
ttl: 86400
});

zone.deleteRecords([
oldNs1Record,
oldNs2Record
], callback);

//-
// Possibly a simpler way to perform the above change is deleting records by
// type.
//-
zone.deleteRecords('ns', callback);

//-
// You can also delete records of multiple types.
//-
zone.deleteRecords(['ns', 'a'], callback);

description.full:
Delete records from this zone. This is a convenience wrapper around
{module:dns/zone#createChange}.

This method accepts {module:dns/record} objects or string record types in
its place. This means that you can delete all A records or NS records, etc.
If used this way, two API requests are made (one to get, then another to
delete), which means the operation is not atomic and could
result in unexpected changes.
description.summary:
Delete records from this zone. This is a convenience wrapper around
{module:dns/zone#createChange}.
description.body:
This method accepts {module:dns/record} objects or string record types in
its place. This means that you can delete all A records or NS records, etc.
If used this way, two API requests are made (one to get, then another to
delete), which means the operation is not atomic and could
result in unexpected changes.

description.full:
Emptying your zone means leaving only 'NS' and 'SOA' records. This method
will first fetch the non-NS and non-SOA records from your zone using
{module:dns/zone#getRecords}, then use {module:dns/zone#createChange} to
create a deletion change.
description.summary:
Emptying your zone means leaving only 'NS' and 'SOA' records. This method
will first fetch the non-NS and non-SOA records from your zone using
{module:dns/zone#getRecords}, then use {module:dns/zone#createChange} to
create a deletion change.

tags.string: {string} localPath - The fully qualified path to the zone file.
tags.name: localPath
tags.description: • The fully qualified path to the zone file.

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An API or file system error.
tags.name: callback.err

tags.html:
var zoneFilename = '/Users/stephen/zonefile.zone';

zone.export(zoneFilename, function(err) {
if (!err) {
// The zone file was created successfully.
}
});

description.full: Provide a path to a zone file to copy records into the zone.
description.summary: Provide a path to a zone file to copy records into the zone.

tags.string: {number} query.maxResults - Maximum number of results to return.
tags.name: query.maxResults

tags.string:
{string} query.sort - Set to 'asc' for ascending, and 'desc' for
    descending or omit for no sorting.
tags.name: query.sort
tags.description: • Set to 'asc' for ascending, and 'desc' for descending or omit for no sorting.

tags.string:
{?object} callback.nextQuery - A query object representing the next
    page of results.
tags.name: callback.nextQuery
tags.description: • A query object representing the next page of results.

tags.html:
var callback = function(err, changes, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
// The metadata property is populated for you with the metadata at the
// time of fetching.
changes[0].metadata;

// However, in cases where you are concerned the metadata could have
// changed, use the getMetadata method.
changes[0].getMetadata(function(err, metadata) {});

if (nextQuery) {
// nextQuery will be non-null if there are more results.
zone.getChanges(nextQuery, callback);
}
};

zone.getChanges(callback);

//-
// Get the changes from your zone as a readable object stream.
//-
zone.getChanges()
.on('error', console.error)
.on('data', function(change) {
// change is a Change object.
})
.on('end', function() {
// All changes retrieved.
});

//-
// If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent
// unnecessary processing and API requests.
//-
zone.getChanges()
.on('data', function(change) {
this.end();
});

description.full:
Get the list of changes associated with this zone. A change is an atomic
update to a collection of records.
description.summary:
Get the list of changes associated with this zone. A change is an atomic
update to a collection of records.

tags.string: {?object} callback.metadata - Metadata of the zone from the API.
tags.name: callback.metadata
tags.description: • Metadata of the zone from the API.

tags.html: zone.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

tags.string:
{string} query.name - Restricts the list to return only records with
    this fully qualified domain name.
tags.name: query.name
tags.description: • Restricts the list to return only records with this fully qualified domain name.

tags.string:
{string} query.type - Restricts the list to return only records of
    this type. If present, the "name" parameter must also be present.
tags.name: query.type
tags.description: • Restricts the list to return only records of this type. If present, the "name" parameter must also be present.

tags.string: {number} query.maxResults - Maximum number of results to be returned.
tags.name: query.maxResults
tags.description: • Maximum number of results to be returned.

tags.string:
{?object} callback.nextQuery - A query object representing the next
    page of results.
tags.name: callback.nextQuery
tags.description: • A query object representing the next page of results.

tags.html:
var callback = function(err, records, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// records is an array of Record objects.
}

if (nextQuery) {
zone.getRecords(nextQuery, callback);
}
};

zone.getRecords(callback);

//-
// Provide a query for further customization.
//-
// Get the namespace records for example.com.
var query = {
name: 'example.com.',
type: 'NS'
};

zone.getRecords(query, callback);

//-
// Get the records from your zone as a readable object stream.
//-
zone.getRecords()
.on('error', console.error)
.on('data', function(record) {
// record is a Record object.
})
.on('end', function() {
// All records retrieved.
});

//-
// If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent
// unnecessary processing and API requests.
//-
zone.getRecords()
.on('data', function(change) {
this.end();
});

//-
// If you only want records of a specific type or types, provide them in
// place of the query object.
//-
zone.getRecords('ns', function(err, records) {
if (!err) {
// records is an array of NS Record objects in your zone.
}
});

//-
// You can also specify multiple record types.
//-
zone.getRecords(['ns', 'a', 'cname'], function(err, records) {
if (!err) {
// records is an array of NS, A, and CNAME records in your zone.
}
});

description.full: Get the list of records for this zone.
description.summary: Get the list of records for this zone.

tags.string: {string} localPath - The fully qualified path to the zone file.
tags.name: localPath
tags.description: • The fully qualified path to the zone file.

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An API or file system error.
tags.name: callback.err

tags.html:
var zoneFilename = '/Users/dave/zonefile.zone';

zone.import(zoneFilename, function(err, change, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// The change was created successfully.
}
});

description.full: Copy the records from a zone file into this zone.
description.summary: Copy the records from a zone file into this zone.

tags.string:
{string} type - The type of record to construct or the type of record
    you are referencing.
tags.name: type
tags.description: • The type of record to construct or the type of record you are referencing.

tags.string: {object} metadata - The metadata of this record.
tags.name: metadata

tags.string:
{string} metadata.name - The name of the record, e.g.
    `www.example.com.`.
tags.name: metadata.name

tags.string:
{string[]} metadata.data - Defined in
    [RFC 1035, section 5](https://goo.gl/9EiM0e) and
    [RFC 1034, section 3.6.1](https://goo.gl/Hwhsu9).
tags.name: metadata.data
tags.description:
• Defined in RFC 1035, section 5 and
    RFC 1034, section 3.6.1.

tags.string:
{number} metadata.ttl - Seconds that the resource is cached by
    resolvers.
tags.name: metadata.ttl
tags.description: • Seconds that the resource is cached by resolvers.

tags.html: {module:dns/record}

//-
// Reference an existing record to delete from your zone.
//-
var oldARecord = zone.record('a', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: '1.2.3.4',
ttl: 86400
});

//-
// Construct a record to add to your zone.
//-
var newARecord = zone.record('a', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: '5.6.7.8',
ttl: 86400
});

//-
// Use these records together to create a change.
//-
zone.createChange({
add: newARecord,
delete: oldARecord
}, function(err, change, apiResponse) {});

description.full:
A {module:dns/record} object can be used to construct a record you want to
add to your zone, or to refer to an existing one.

Note that using this method will not itself make any API requests. You will
use the object returned in other API calls, for example to add a record to
your zone or to delete an existing one.
description.summary:
A {module:dns/record} object can be used to construct a record you want to
add to your zone, or to refer to an existing one.
description.body:
Note that using this method will not itself make any API requests. You will
use the object returned in other API calls, for example to add a record to
your zone or to delete an existing one.

tags.string: {string|string[]} recordTypes - Type(s) of records to replace.
tags.name: recordTypes

tags.string:
{module:dns/record|module:dns/record[]} newRecords - The record
    objects to add.
tags.name: newRecords

tags.html:
var newNs1Record = zone.record('ns', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: 'ns-cloud1.googledomains.com.',
ttl: 86400
});

var newNs2Record = zone.record('ns', {
name: 'example.com.',
data: 'ns-cloud2.googledomains.com.',
ttl: 86400
});

var newNsRecords = [
newNs1Record,
newNs2Record
];

zone.replaceRecords('ns', newNsRecords, function(err, change, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// The change was created successfully.
}
});

description.full:
Provide a record type that should be deleted and replaced with other records.

This is not an atomic request. Two API requests are made
(one to get records of the type that you've requested, then another to
replace them), which means the operation is not atomic and could result in
unexpected changes.
description.summary: Provide a record type that should be deleted and replaced with other records.
description.body:
This is not an atomic request. Two API requests are made
(one to get records of the type that you've requested, then another to
replace them), which means the operation is not atomic and could result in
unexpected changes.

tags.string: {string[]} recordTypes - Types of records to delete. Ex: 'NS', 'A'.
tags.name: recordTypes

tags.html:
zone.deleteRecordsByType_(['NS', 'A'], function(err, change, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// The change was created successfully.
}
});

description.full: Delete records from the zone matching an array of types.
description.summary: Delete records from the zone matching an array of types.

description.full:
Developer Documentation

These methods can be used with either a callback or as a readable object
stream. streamRouter is used to add this dual behavior.
description.body:
These methods can be used with either a callback or as a readable object
stream. streamRouter is used to add this dual behavior.

code:
streamRouter.extend(Zone, ['getChanges', 'getRecords']);

module.exports = Zone;
